body.p: A Kentucky attorney. Born in Trigg County, Kentucky. Educated at Cumberland College and under George P. Street. Received his legal education under Judge Collins D. Bradley in 1845 and admitted to the bar in 1846. Moved to Madisonville, Kentucky in 1846 and began practicing law. Married twice, first to Sarah E. Pary Waddill and on a second occasion to M. Maria E. Pratt Waddill. Father of three children, including Otway W. Waddill and Joseph C. Waddill. Owned three enslaved persons in 1860. Member of the Whig Party and Republican Party. Served as an elder of the Hopkins County Christian Church starting in 1851. Served as Hopkins County attorney from 1851 to 1855 and again from 1863 to 1867. A partner in the law firm of Earle & Waddill, with John B. Earle, at Madisonville, Kentucky in 1852. A sole practitioner in Madisonville, Kentucky in 1853 and 1856. A partner in the law firm of Arnold & Waddill, with John E. Arnold, at Madisonville, Kentucky in 1859.
